item.title: The Conservative Case for Leaving Harvard Alone
item.description: The Supreme Court precedent allowing the IRS to revoke a university’s tax-exempt status is a textualist’s nightmare.

item.title: The Gleeful, Chaotic World of Underground Comics
item.description: Diane DiMassa’s Hothead Paisan is full of unrestrained, devil-may-care attitude.

item.title: About That ‘Possible Sign of Life’ on a Distant Planet
item.description: Possible is doing a lot of work.

item.title: Trump Is Flirting With Economic Disaster
item.description: By threatening the independence of the Federal Reserve, the president risks undermining many of his key goals.

item.title: The Lies About Josh Shapiro Have Consequences
item.description: An attack on the Pennsylvania governor shows the dangers of tendentious misrepresentations.

item.title: The Harem of Elon Musk
item.description: The DOGE leader is offering the Republican Party a very different vision of fatherhood.

item.title: The Triumph of a Film That Flips on Us Halfway In
item.description: Sinners slowly drops its period-drama trappings to become something much scarier.

item.title: PBS Pulled a Film for Political Reasons, Then Changed Its Mind
item.description: A window into how the network is handling the new Trump era

item.title: Photos of the Week: Holy Week, Tapir Calf, Whale Kites
item.description: A colorful tulip festival in England, the Irish World Dancing Championships in Dublin, ice climbing in Nepal, performances from the first weekend of Coachella, and much more

item.title: Grover Norquist Can’t Believe What He’s Hearing
item.description: Is the GOP about to raise taxes?

item.title: A Trade War With China Is a Very Bad Idea
item.description: Yes, the U.S. has the larger consumer economy. No, that won’t be enough to avoid major (and majorly self-inflicted) pain.

item.title: Even Netflix Can’t Escape the Black Mirror Treatment
item.description: The sci-fi series takes aim at a very familiar target in its new season.

item.title: Life Before the Measles Vaccine
item.description: When the virus was endemic, it spread in a world very different from today’s.

item.title: What Recourse Does the Supreme Court Actually Have?
item.description: As the Trump administration talks itself into refusing to comply with judicial orders, federal judges are moving closer to deploying the most powerful tool they have: contempt of court.

item.title: What Does the Literature of the Working Class Look Like?
item.description: A new entrant to the genre of workplace literature argues that even mundane labor shapes your identity.

item.title: The Key to Critical Self-Awareness
item.description: The ancient-Greek commandment Know thyself turns out to be a great modern way to become happier, more empathetic, and more successful.

item.title: Trump Needs Someone to Blame
item.description: The Federal Reserve chairman, Jerome Powell, is that someone.

item.title: Ed Martin Has Completely Disqualified Himself
item.description: Trump’s pick for U.S. attorney is a Russian-state-TV darling.

item.title: A Loophole That Would Swallow the Constitution
item.description: If Donald Trump can disappear people to El Salvador without due process, he can do anything.

item.title: America’s Mad King
item.description: The president has grown more impulsive, more vindictive, and more anarchic.

item.title: The Disaster of School Closures Should Have Been Foreseen
item.description: A plan was set in motion with no idea of how to stop it.

item.title: How Organ Meat Got Into Smoothies
item.description: Americans hated offal. Now it’s a trendy food—in grocery stores and online.

item.title: Democrats Need ‘Imperfect Allies’
item.description: A conversation with Sarah McBride

item.title: How America Can Avoid Becoming Russia
item.description: Political pressure must be brought to bear—through the courts, the press, and the states, but also applied to legislators while they still have any power left.

item.title: ‘In Three Months, Half of Them Will Be Dead’
item.description: Elon Musk promised to preserve lifesaving aid to foreign children. Then the Trump administration quietly canceled it.
